label: 常夏
本: The Tale of Genji (Penguin Classics) . Viking Adult . 2001
説明文: A flower of the dianthus family, the same one as the "pink" (nadeshiko).  The two terms are distinguished by their use in the tale.  Partly because of an established pun on the lovers’ “sleeping place” (toko), tokonatsu refers to lovers and nadeshiko to a child.[撫子、床、常夏][RK]
